text:
mod_autoindex  shows files in a directory listing, which should be excluded by 
IndexIgnore by adding an additional slash in the URL.

Example:
  http://www-user.tu-chemnitz.de/~fri/test/autoindex/  - ok, hides aa.dontshow
  http://www-user.tu-chemnitz.de/~fri/test//autoindex/ - not ok, shows aa.dontshow

.htaccess contains:
IndexIgnore *.dontshow

Thanks,
Frank
creator: frank.richter@hrz.tu-chemnitz.de
jim@apache.org
text: reopen if bug still exists with 1.3.34-dev

This is still an issue for Apache 1.3.34 at least on win32:

For a call of http://localhost//test/ IndexIgnore set in /test/.htaccess is
being ignored (but the directive used in httpd.conf, per-server context, works).
It does work if I call http://localhost/test/, of course.

A call of http://localhost//test/ and IndexIgnore now set in /.htaccess works as
expected.

Summarizing: IndexIgnore was always set in /test/.htaccess

http://localhost//test/ ->IndexIgnore does not work
http://localhost/test// ->IndexIgnore works
http://localhost/test//data/ -> IndexIgnore works
http://localhost//test/data/ -> IndexIgnore does not work
http://localhost/test/data/ -> IndexIgnore works
